abstract: It took Hillary Clinton a few swipes (five, to be precise, but who’s counting?) of her MetroCard to go through the turnstile at 116th Street in the Bronx on Thursday, but at least she knew that the New York City subway no longer accepts tokens.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Rides the No. 4, and Her MetroCard (Eventually) Fits Fine

snippet: It took Hillary Clinton a few swipes (five, to be precise, but who’s counting?) of her MetroCard to go through the turnstile at 116th Street in the Bronx on Thursday, but at least she knew that the New York City subway no longer accepts tokens.
